required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Bioequivalence Study Of Gabapentin Between Tablet And Liquid Formulation And The Food Effect Study Of Liquid Formulation
clinical_study.official_title: An Open, Randomized, Crossover Study In Healthy Subjects To Assess The Bioequivalence Of Gabapentin Between Japanese Commercial Tablet And Japanese Commercial Image Liquid Formulation And The Effect Of Food On The Pharmacokinetics Of Japanese Commercial Image Liquid Formulation

brief_summary.textblock: Primary objective for this study is to demonstrate bioequivalence between Japanese commercial tablet and Japanese commercial image liquid formulation. Secondary objective for this study is to estimate the food effect for Japanese commercial image liquid formulation.

primary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetic (PK) Endpoints - Primary: plasma Cmax and AUCt of gabapentin. - Secondary: plasma AUCinf, AUClast, Tmax, kel, MRT and t1/2 of gabapentin

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety Endpoints - Adverse events and safety laboratory data

arm_group.arm_group_label: Period I: Tablet(400 mg single dose)
arm_group.description: Period I: Tablet in fasting state, Period II: Liquid formulation in fasting state, Period III: Liquid formulation in fed state

arm_group.arm_group_label: Period I: Liquid formulation(400 mg single dose)
arm_group.description: Period I: Liquid formulation in fasting state, Period II: Tablet in fasting state, Period III: Liquid formulation in fed state

intervention.description: Period I: Tablet in fasting state(400 mg single dose on Day 1 only of each Period; subjects stay in clinic for a total of 4 days for each period), Period II: Liquid formulation in fasting state(400 mg single dose on Day 1 only of each Period; subjects stay in clinic for a total of 4 days for each period), Period III: Liquid formulation(400 mg single dose on Day 1 only of each Period; subjects stay in clinic for a total of 4 days for each period) in fed state
intervention.arm_group_label: Period I: Tablet(400 mg single dose)

intervention.description: Period I: Liquid formulation in fasting state(400 mg single dose on Day 1 only of each Period; subjects stay in clinic for a total of 4 days for each period), Period II: Tablet in fasting state(400 mg single doseon Day 1 only of each Period; subjects stay in clinic for a total of 4 days for each period), Period III: Liquid formulation(400 mg single doseon Day 1 only of each Period; subjects stay in clinic for a total of 4 days for each period) in fed state
intervention.arm_group_label: Period I: Liquid formulation(400 mg single dose)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Healthy volunteers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Evidence or history of clinically significant hematological, renal, endocrine, pulmonary, gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, hepatic, psychiatric, neurologic, or allergic disease
